metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3570 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple heap buffer overflows in tiffcrop.c utility in libtiff libraryVersion 4.4.0 allows attacker to trigger unsafe or out of bounds memoryaccess via crafted TIFF image file which could result into applicationcrash, potential information disclosure or any other context-dependentimpact

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3570` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm5').
